div.style: position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; z-index: 100001; background-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); opacity: 0.5; display: none;

h1.span: Attention: We are still experiencing some issues with a few of the video links. Most lessons now have a new link or an additional video to help resolve the problem. If you are experiencing any challenges with today's lesson, try doing a different subject today and coming back to the lesson at a different time. We will continue to resolve issues and provide online educational opportunities during this challenging time. Thank you for your support and patience.

div.p:
Parents and students the links below provide your online learning resources for the 2019-2020 school year. The links provide lessons, videos, and practices to begin on April 13, 2020 and conclude on May 15, 2020. Students in grades K-8 will select the calendar for their grade level. Students in grades 9-11 will select the core subject areas in which they are currently enrolled (Secondary English, Secondary Social Sciences, Secondary Science, and Secondary Math). Friday Fun Lessons are optional but a great opportunity for students and the whole family.
You may need a PDF reader and FLASH player to access some material. If you are unable to print a worksheet, you may write your responses on a sheet of paper. If you run into any trouble, speak with your teacher.
Do Your Best! Stay Safe! We can't wait to see you back in school!
Have Questions? View The Video Tutorial below From Superintendent Dr. Barnett Regarding Student Lessons

span.br:
To access these helpful resources, your student will use their Google account to log in to Clever.com. All the resources will be present on the first page under the heading "Away from School - Helpful Resources." If you experience any trouble accessing these, you can contact Rob Hullett at rlhullett@dekalbk12.org or Abbey Thomas at jathomas@dekalbk12.org
The librarians of Dekalb County Schools have built a website full of useful, fun, and interesting resources for students of all ages. It can be found by clicking here.
If you cannot access Clever, a list of available resources can also be found here.
***The PebbleGo and PebbleGo Next resources require a username and password.***
Username: avl
Password: avl
Resources for gifted students and other extensions to lessons may be found here.

div.h2: Capstone Library Books - Access over 25,000 books

a.title: DeKalb County Schools Clever Login Page

span.style: color: rgb(40, 40, 40); font-family: latoregular, serif; letter-spacing: 0.25pt;

p.span: DeKalb County Schools District offers K-12 education to nearly 9,000 students across thirteen schools. We strive to meet the needs of a well-rounded student body by providing rigorous academic offerings, a variety of extracurricular activities, sports programs, Arts integration programs, as well as having a stand along career and technical center (DeKalb County Technology Center).

span.style: color: rgb(40, 40, 40); font-family: latoregular, serif; letter-spacing: 0.25pt;

p.span: Our campuses are the center of their respective communities, and the pride and support are evident upon any visit at one of our campuses. We hope you are able to find the information you need on and enjoy visiting our newly revised website.

br.br:
Physical Address
306 Main Street West
Rainsville, AL 35986
